message: My mother just received a Kindle, and I'm setting the thing up for her. I noticed that the screen's 'colour' inverts everytime you change page, is that normal? Also, it won't connect to the home wi-fi network, while my BlackBerry connected without a problem.

Assuming it doesn't stay inverted, that brief bit of inversion every time you turn the page is normal. As for the wifi, it does seem to be pretty finicky. I often have to reset my router to get the Kindle to connect.
Thanks, got it all sorted now. Quite a slick device.
Another quick question, when you put it to sleep, does an image always remain on the screen stating how to wake it up?
Interesting. Am I correct in thinking it doesn't drain power in holding an image then?
That's… part of the whole point of e-paper, innit?
It only uses power to change the image, which is why the battery can go for over a month.

Interestingly, I've read that the new B&N Nook does the full-field inversion thing (the black screen) only on (exactly) every 6th page change.  Which means that they're now able to make e-paper that stays "clean" after multiple updates.

Also:  What I'm really looking forward to are the hybrid LCD/e-paper displays that a number of companies have been patenting.  Esp. the idea of dynamically switching parts of the screen between LCD and e-paper based on content (an Apple patent).
I have a Kindle, but sadly I still can't get myself to read books on it. I still prefer the old paper based versions.
@Mr_V Heck if I know. I only know some of the details. I figured the principle advantage was the lack of glare.
Despite the question mark, I was actually making a statement.  :)
Also, I was happily jumping between three different books on the plane. Clunky paperbacks can die in a fire.
Yeah, I don't know if I could ever go back to those dinosaurs. The combination of the Kindle and the Kindle app on my phone has revolutionised -- and significantly reinvigorated -- my reading habits.
@Mr_V No, no, I got that. I was just making it clear that I had no prior idea.
